Kelompok militan Hamas melancarkan serangan dadakan ke Israel, Sabtu (7/10) dini hari. Serangan itu jadi yang terbesar dalam beberapa tahun ini. Dilansir Al Jazeera, jubir Hamas mengatakan operasi militer dilakukan sebagai respons atas kekejaman yang telah dialami Palestina selama berpuluh-puluh tahun. â€œKami ingin komunitas internasional menghentikan kekerasan di Gaza, terhadap rakyat Palestina dan tempat suci kami seperti Al-Aqsa. Ini adalah alasan dimulainya pertempuran ini,â€?tambahnya. Militan bersenjata Hamas tampak memasuki kota-kota Israel, dengan laporan sejumlah baku tembak di selatan Israel. Serangan juga diiringi rentetan roket Hamas dari Jalur Gaza. Setidaknya 40 warga Israel tewas dan 500 lebih lainnya luka, kata layanan ambulans Israel. Otoritas kesehatan di Palestina melaporkan setidaknya 198 warga Gaza tewas, dengan 1.610 lainnya terluka. Militer Israel menyebut telah meluncurkan serangan udara ke Gaza, dengan laporan suara ledakan di sana. Media Israel Reshet 13 TV News juga melaporkan, sejumlah orang di kota Ofakim disandera militan Hamas. Dalam video pengumumannya, Komandan Militer Hamas Mohammad Deif menyerukan warga Palestina di mana pun untuk bertempur. Perdana Menteri Israel Benjamin Netanyahu pun bersikukuh untuk melawan dan 'menangi perang'. Sementara itu, warga Palestina di Gaza mulai bersiap dengan mengungsi dan menyetok sembako. Pertempuran terbesar Israel dan Hamas terakhir terjadi selama 10 hari pada 2021. Presiden Palestina Mahmoud Abbas membela serangan Hamas ini. â€œRakyat Palestina punya hak untuk membela diri dari teror yang dilakukan oleh pemukim dan pasukan pendudukan (Israel-red),â€?ujar Abbas dikutip kantor berita WAFA. Amerika Serikat, Jerman, Prancis, Inggris, Belanda, Ukraina, dan sejumlah pejabat Uni Eropa mengutuk keras serangan yang disebut 'aksi teroris', sementara Turki dan Rusia meminta Hamas dan Israel untuk menahan diri. Arab Saudi, melalui Kementerian Luar Negerinya, menyerukan kekerasan antara Israel dan Palestina untuk segera berhenti, sambil terus mengikuti perkembangan ini.

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, this evening, at the Kirya in Tel Aviv: "Dear citizens of Israel, This morning, on Shabbat and a holiday, Hamas invaded Israeli territory and murdered innocent citizens including children and the elderly. Hamas has started a brutal and evil war. We will be victorious in this war despite an unbearable price. This is a very difficult day for all of us. Hamas wants to murder us all. This is an enemy that murders children and mothers in their homes, in their beds, an enemy that abducts the elderly, children and young women, that slaughters and massacres our citizens, including children, who simply went out to enjoy the holiday. What happened today is unprecedented in Israel â€?and I will see to it that it does not happen again. The entire government is behind this decision. The IDF will immediately use all its strength to destroy Hamas's capabilities. We will destroy them and we will forcefully avenge this dark day that they have forced on the State of Israel and its citizens. As Bialik wrote: 'Revenge for the blood of a little child has yet been devised by Satan'. All of the places which Hamas is deployed, hiding and operating in, that wicked city, we will turn them into rubble. I say to the residents of Gaza: Leave now because we will operate forcefully everywhere. At this hour, the IDF is clearing the terrorists out of the last communities. They are going community by community, house by house, and are restoring our control. I embrace and send heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families whose loved ones were murdered today in cold blood and endless brutality. We are all praying for the well-being of the wounded and all those who are being held hostage. I say to Hamas: You are responsible for their well-being. Israel will settle accounts with anyone who harms one hair on their heads. I appeal to the residents of the south: We all stand alongside you. We are all proud of your heroism and your fighting. To our beloved IDF soldiers, police officers and security forces personnel, remember that you are the continuation of the heroes of the Jewish people, of Joshua, Judah Maccabee and the heroes of 1948 and of all of Israel's wars. You are now fighting for the home and future of us all. We are all with you. We all love you. We all salute you. To the medical and rescue teams, and the many volunteers who came out in force today in a long list of places, the people of Israel salute you. With your spirit, we will overcome our enemies. Today, I spoke with US President Biden and with other world leaders in order to ensure freedom of action for Israel in the continuation of the campaign. I thank President Biden for his strong and clear words. I thank the President of France, the Prime Minister of Great Britain and many other leaders for their unreserved support for Israel. I now appeal to all citizens of Israel. We stand together in this campaign. This war will take time. It will be difficult. Challenging days are ahead of us. However, I can promise one thing: With the help of G-d, the forces that we all have in common and our faith in the Eternal One of Israel, we will win." Video: GPO

Palestinian militants in the Gaza Strip carried out an unprecedented infiltration Saturday into southern Israel, sending fighters across the border and firing thousands of rockets into the country as the ruling Hamas militant group announced the beginning of a new operation.

The Israeli military put the country on war alert and began striking targets in Gaza in response, setting the stage for what was likely to be a new heavy round of fighting between the bitter enemies. In a serious escalation, salvos of rockets fired from Gaza set off constant air raid sirens as far north as Jerusalem.

Videos posted on social media showed what appeared to be uniformed Palestinian gunmen inside the Israeli border town of Sderot.

A video from Gaza showed what looked like the lifeless body of an Israeli soldier being trampled by an angry crowd of Palestinians shouting â€œGod is Great.â€?Other footage appeared to show Palestinian militants dragging away an Israeli soldier, still alive, on a motorcycle and Palestinian men dancing atop an Israeli tank that had been set ablaze. The authenticity of the videos could not immediately be verified.

The elusive leader of Hamasâ€?military wing, Mohammed Deif, announced the beginning of what he called â€œOperation Al-Aqsa Storm.â€?
â€œToday the people are regaining their revolution,â€?he said in the recorded message, as he called on Palestinians from east Jerusalem to northern Israel to join the fight and â€œexpel the occupiers and demolish the walls.â€?
â€œWe must set the earth on fire under the feet of the occupiers,â€?he said, claiming that Hamas had fired over 5,000 rockets into #Israel.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahuâ€˜s office said heâ€™d convene his #security cabinet for urgent discussions.

The escalation comes at a delicate time for his far-right government, as protests against the governmentâ€™s deeply divisive plan to overhaul the judiciary have spread even within the ranks of the #military.

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel is "at war"after Gaza militants launched a surprise attack Saturday, firing thousands of rockets and entering Israel by land, sea and air using paragliders. Dozens of people have died and nearly 800 are wounded in Israel, officials said. 

The Israel Defense Forces said its troops are fighting in at least a half-dozen locations. Some residents in Israel said militants were trying to break into their homes. Hamas claimed to have captured several Israeli soldiers near the border.

Via @cnn
â€?@Riemoh

Israel battled on Saturday to repel one of the broadest invasions of its territory in 50 years after Palestinian militants from Gaza launched an enormous and coordinated early-morning assault on southern Israel, infiltrating several Israeli towns and army bases, kidnapping Israeli civilians and soldiers, and firing thousands of rockets toward cities as far away as Jerusalem.

By early evening, the Israeli military said fighting continued in at least five places in southern Israel, around 70 Israelis had been reported dead by emergency medical groups, and Israel had retaliated with huge strikes on Gazan cities. At least 198 Palestinians were killed in either gun battles or airstrikes, the Gazan Health Ministry said.

The Hamas militants behind the attack also took Israelis hostage, the chief spokesman for the Israeli military, Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari, said. 

In an assault without recent precedent in its complexity and scale, the militants crossed into Israel by land, sea and air, according to the Israeli military, leading to some of the first pitched battles between large groups of Israeli and Arab forces on Israeli soil in decades. As of early evening there were the two main battles taking place, near the towns of Ofakim and Beeri, Admiral Hagai said.

All told, the Israeli military said that the militants had entered at least 22 Israeli towns, abducting soldiers and civilians, including an older grandmother. Residents of Israeli border towns told broadcasters that gunmen were moving door to door, looking for civilians. Unverified footage appeared to show Palestinian fighters transporting captured Israeli civilians and bodies through the strip.

â€œWe are at war and we will win it,â€?Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said in a televised statement, announcing a call-up of Israeli military reservists.

You may have noticed distorted headlines about Palestinian resistance fighters today. A reminder that what took place today is in direct response to more than 75 years of ethnic cleansing, subjugation, and oppression meted out by Israeli colonizers. 

For the people of Gaza, who have endured over 15 years of Israeli siege, bombing campaigns, and collective punishment, resistance is their way of seeking a dignified life. Today, they broke free, if only for a moment, to show the world that freedom for Gaza and all of Palestine is an undeniable truth on the horizon. 

There will be no peace, calm, or normalcy from the river to the sea without ending Israeli colonial violence. Palestinians cannot be expected to be complicit in the face of increasing brutality, impunity, and lack of accountability. No more lives need to be lost. The sun had just risen over Israelâ€™s Negev desert, and at the all-night outdoor rave at Kibbutz Reâ€™im, the party was still going. Thumping trance music was playing full volume, and under brightly-coloured canopies, hundreds of revellers were dancing themselves into exhaustion.
#Israel #Gaza #Hamas
Then, just as chill-out time began to beckon, uninvited guests arrived. On footage captured by a partygoerâ€™s mobile phone, several small black dots can be seen approaching in the dawn sky from the direction of Gaza. As the cameraman shouts what appears to be a warning, fellow revellers ignore him, unable to hear because of the music.

Moments later, the dancing stops as the airborne arrivals are revealed as motorised paragliders carrying armed Hamas militants. As rocket fire also begins, the dancers flee for their lives â€?chased by gunmen bent on shooting or kidnapping anyone in their path.

Following the rampage, which began at around 7am on Saturday, dozens of partygoers were reported to have been killed or kidnapped, with many more still missing. The unconscious body of a dreadlocked female attendee was later paraded through Gaza in a truck, as passers-by spat on her. Among those reported to have been captured was a 26-year-old British citizen, Jake Marlowe, who was helping with security at the rave.

An explosion rocked the Gaza strip on Saturday (October 7), sending smoke and dust across the city, after the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas launched a surprise assault that combined gunmen crossing into Israel with a barrage of rockets fired from Gaza.

The Israeli military said it had responded with air strikes into Gaza, after Hamas launched a raid into Israel on Saturday.

Reuters video captured the moment a building was struck in Gaza city, spewing plumes of thick black smoke into the air.

The building which collapsed after air strike, called "Palestine Tower", is the headquarters of several offices of media institutions in the city.

Israel said the Iran-backed group had declared war as its army confirmed fighting with militants in several Israeli towns and military bases near Gaza, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to retaliate.

At least 100 Israelis are reported dead, with hundreds more wounded in the attack.

The Israeli military confirmed Israelis were being held captive in Gaza and soldiers have been killed, according to N12 and Reshet 13 news outlets.

Rocket attack makes direct hit on apartment in Ashkelon in southern Israel, police say

The Hamas rocket attack on Sunday targeting Ashkelon made a "direct hit," according to Israeli Police.

Police said the rocket fire hit an apartment building.

Ashkelon is not far north of the border with the Gaza Strip.
A building in Ashkelon was directly hit by a rocket early Monday after a barrage of rockets were fired on the city from the Gaza Strip.

Israel at War | At Least 700 Israelis Killed, 2,000 Wounded; Over 130 Civilians and Soldiers Held Hostage in Gaza

Hamas, which earlier said it was targeting Ben Gurion International Airport, also said it had launched "a major missile attack with 100 rockets" on Ashkelon in southern Israel.

The rockets were fired at the coastal city in response to Israel Defense Forces "targeting of their safe houses," said the Izzedine al Qassam Brigades, the armed wing of the Palestinian militant group.

Ashkelon is not far north of the border with the Gaza Strip.

Another barrage of rockets were fired towards the city minutes later.

Adam Boehler Suggests Iran's Influence in Israel-Gaza Conflict

  Adam Boehler, a prominent figure in U.S. foreign policy, has suggested that the ongoing conflict between Israel and Gaza would not have occurred without Iran's involvement. Boehler, known for his insights into international relations, pointed to Iran's role in fueling tensions in the region.

  Boehler's comments come as the Israel-Gaza conflict continues to escalate, with both sides exchanging airstrikes and rocket attacks. He emphasized that Iran's support for militant groups, such as Hamas, plays a significant part in perpetuating the violence.

  According to Boehler, Iran's influence in the conflict is evident in its provision of financial aid, weapons, and training to these groups. He believes that without Iran's backing, the intensity of the conflict would likely diminish.
  While the primary focus of the Israel-Gaza conflict lies in the longstanding territorial disputes and political grievances between the two sides, Boehler's remarks provide valuable insights into the broader geopolitical context. They also underscore the need for diplomatic efforts to mitigate Iran's involvement and promote a peaceful resolution.

  As the violence persists, international attention remains fixed on the Israel-Gaza conflict. Boehler's observations serve as a reminder that addressing the underlying factors, including external influences, is crucial for long-term stability and peace in the region.

  The ongoing conflict highlights the intricate web of geopolitical interests and power dynamics that shape the Middle East. Efforts to de-escalate tensions and foster dialogue between all parties involved will be key to finding a lasting resolution to the crisis.

Israel Engages in War as Massive Explosions Rock Gaza in Hamas Offensive

 In a heightened escalation of tensions, Israel finds itself at war as massive explosions rock the Gaza Strip following a series of attacks by Hamas. The ongoing conflict has raised concerns over the worsening situation in the region and the potential for further violence.

 The hostilities were triggered when Hamas, a Palestinian militant group, launched a barrage of rockets towards Israeli cities. In response, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) swiftly retaliated by launching airstrikes on multiple targets within Gaza. These airstrikes resulted in large-scale explosions and significant destruction across the territory.

 The violence has already claimed numerous lives on both sides, with reports of casualties and injuries continuing to rise. Civilians, including women and children, are unfortunately caught in the crossfire, further amplifying the humanitarian crisis.

 The international community has expressed deep concern over the situation and has called for an immediate cessation of hostilities. Diplomatic efforts are underway to de-escalate the conflict and prevent further loss of life. However, achieving a peaceful resolution remains a daunting task in such a volatile and deeply entrenched conflict.

 The current conflict between Israel and Hamas has once again highlighted the long-standing tensions and the urgent need for a comprehensive and lasting solution. The situation is rapidly evolving, and the world watches with apprehension as the violence continues to escalate.

Yom Kippur War History: 
Yom Kippur War Arab Israeli conflict was the fourth of the Wars fought on Israel Arab dispute ,a significant event in the Arab-Israeli, which began on October 6, 1973, when Egypt and Syria launched a surprise attack on Israel during the Yom Kippur holiday. The war lasted for nearly three weeks and resulted in significant casualties on both sides.

Yom Kippur War Arab Israel Background:
The war was initiated by Egypt and Syria in an attempt to regain territory lost to Israel in the Six-Day War. The Egyptian and Syrian forces launched a coordinated attack against Israel on Yom Kippur, a Jewish holiday when many Israelis were not expecting an attack.

Yom Kippur War a Surprise for Israel:
Israel was initially caught off guard by the attack, but it quickly mobilized its forces and counterattacked. The war was fought on two fronts: the Sinai Peninsula and the Golan Heights. Israel eventually gained the upper hand in the war, but it received significant support from the United States, both in terms of military aid and diplomatic support.

Yom Kippur War Outcome :
The war ended on October 25, 1973, with a ceasefire agreement. Israel emerged from the war victorious, but it had suffered significant casualties. The war also led to an increase in tensions between Israel and its neighbors and contributed to further conflicts, such as the Lebanese Civil War.

The following are some of the important points to note about the  Arab Israel Yom Kippur War Conflict:

It was the fourth of the Arab-Israeli wars.
It was initiated by Egypt and Syria.
It began when Egyptian and Syrian forces launched a coordinated attack against Israel on Yom Kippur.
The war saw significant losses on both sides, with Israel ultimately emerging victorious after receiving support from the United States.
The war led to an increase in tensions between Israel and its neighbors and contributed to further conflicts, such as the Lebanese Civil War.

The Yom Kippur War was a significant event in the history of the Middle East, and it continues to have an impact on the region today.
